Command or Action
enable Example: Device> enable
configure terminal Example: Device# configure terminal
crypto ikev2 name-mangler mangler-name Example: Device(config)# crypto ikev2 name-mangler mangler1
dn {common-name | country | domain | locality | organization | organization-unit | state} Example: Device(config-ikev2-name-mangler)# dn state

eap {all | dn {common-name | country | domain | locality | organization | organization-unit | state} | prefix | suffix {delimiter {. | @ | \}}} Example: Device(config-ikev2-name-mangler)# eap prefix delimiter @
email {all | domain | username} Example: Device(config-ikev2-name-mangler)# email username
fqdn {all | domain | hostname} Example: Device(config-ikev2-name-mangler)# fqdn domain
end Example: Device(config-ikev2-name-mangler)# end
Purpose
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Enters global configuration mode.
Defines a name mangler and enters IKEv2 name mangler configuration mode.
Derives the name from any of the following fields in the remote identity of type DN (distinguished name). common-name country domain locality organization organization-unit state

Derives the name from the remote identity of type EAP (Extensible Authentication Protocol). all--Derives the name from the entire EAP identity. dn--Derives the name from any of the following fields in the remote EAP identity of type DN: common-name country domain locality organization organization-unit state prefix--Derives the name from the prefix in the EAP identity. suffix--Derives the name from the suffix in the EAP identity. delimiter {. | @ | \}--Specifies the delimiter in the EAP identity that separates the prefix and the suffix.

Derives the name from the remote identity of type e-mail. all--Derives the name from the entire remote IKE identity of type e-mail. domain--Derives the name from the domain part of the remote IKE identity. username--Derives the name from the username part of the remote IKE identity.

Derives the name from the remote identity of type FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name). all--Derives the name from the entire remote IKE identity of type FQDN. domain--Derives the name from the domain part of the remote IKE identity. hostname--Derives the name from the hostname part of the remote IKE identity.
Exits IKEv2 name mangler configuration mode and returns to privileged EXEC mode.

The name is derived from specified portions of different
